Description: Disease associated to this protein feature

Coordinates in a 1 or 2D space, for instance length/coordinates in a sequence.

Usage (example): Use a QuantitativeValue with properties minValue and maxValue for a region or value for a site in a Protein. Use it only with value for a protein length.

List with types preferably supported by BioSchemas-> enumeration list of values maintained on a wikipage (cf accessibilityAPI in schema.org for implementation). If the value is not on the list then the data will still be parsed but only generic properties will be validated.
{population,individual,tissue,cell,molecule,protein,nucleic acid}

A pointer to another, somehow related entity.
Usage: Whenever isBasedOn/isBasisFor, isPartOf/hasPart, citation or any other more specific does not work.

A resource for which this resource has been used for the creation of the former.

Inverse property: isBasedOn
To associate a biological entity to phenotypic information , whether the entity presents the phenotype or causes it.
Representation of this entity. For instance, chemical structure or sequence
Clarify usage...
A url pointing to NCBI Taxonomy or a taxonomic resource

Property: Reused properties from various in BiologicalEntity

Description: A citation or reference to a creative work, such as a publication, web page, scholarly article, etc.
The date on which the BiologicalEntity was created or the item was added to a DataFeed.
The date on which the BiologicalEntity was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed.
Date of first broadcast/publication.
A downloadable form of this entity, at a specific location, in a specific format

Indicates a BiologicalEntity that is (in some sense) a part of this BiologicalEntity.
Inverse property: isPartOf.
A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html. Supersedes isBasedOnUrl.

Indicates a BiologicalEntity that this BiologicalEntity is (in some sense) part of.
 Inverse property: hasPart.

Position where this entity is located or originates from (e.g. an entity from Polynesia islands or an Anatomical location. If multiple locations with multiple purposes (collection, storage) should be modelled, please use the additionalProperty from Place to specify this.
To describe the process used to obtain a biological entity or which is associated with that entity (i.e procedure to obtain it or measure/characterise it)

CretiveWork, Dataset, collection mentioning this entity

Inverse of:mentions
A property-value pair representing an additional characteristics of the entitity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.
An alias for the item.
A description of the item.

The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See background notes for more details. Recommendation: identifiers.org whenever possible
An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.
The name of the item.
URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.
URL of the item.
